dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm telling you, the Van Noys are fine.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Bullshit, Graham. They don't just abandon orders, and they weren't at the ruins. Where in this sulfur-sodden hellhole did you send them?

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: They're on a very important - ah. We'll continue this later.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Welcome back, Captain.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I got your rollers, and she had those cartridges after all.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I got your rollers. The rest of your account went to food and medicine.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who are the Van Noys?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Dammit. I was hoping you'd have more sense than our venerable leader here. I get the message is important, but so's eating.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Carlotta usually schedules the next drop during the meeting. When's she coming?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: She isn't. Sanjar has declared a stop-sale on goods to the Iconoclasts.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've got bad news. Sanjar's made it illegal to sell to you guys.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't know what you did to piss him off, but Sanjar isn't selling to you anymore.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: That is... most unfortunate.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: This cuts off one of our only two supply lines on Monarch. Sanjar, old friend... you're about to cross a dangerous line.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: About to? That idiot just declared war.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: I... we will deal with his subversion later. For now, we must redouble our efforts to spread the truth to the colony.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let me ask you something about spreading the truth.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Even if we clean up the press, how will you get the magazines to Terra 2?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What, exactly, are you going to put in these magazines?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why go through all this trouble? What are you trying to accomplish?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Right. Back to the mission.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Our very resourceful SubLight friends have already agreed to help. For their standard fee, of course.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: They'll replace periodicals around the colony with our subtly edited versions. The Board's workers will learn of our truth without even realizing it.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: A subtle lesson here, a word about the Eternal there. In small ways, I hope to bend the public's mind toward seeing the truth.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: The corporations have been shackling workers' souls for centuries. Workers are glorified slaves. To their companies, to their society, to their own minds.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Free will has all but vanished. I believe that by freeing oneself from the corporate structure - indeed, from the very rules of man! - one can find their own truth.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: And... through that... the cosmic truth that binds us all. The Eternal Truth.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Certainly.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: The Board must have gotten ahold of him at last.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Thank the Eternal that SOMEONE's got some sense in their head.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: You needn't concern yourself with trifling logistics.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Trifling logistics?!

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: They're our best unit, and now they're missing in action!

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: And we'll continue that discussion later.
